intro: Byrsonima decipiens, commonly known as the false jujube, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to edible, red, fleshy fruits. The fruits are often used in traditional medicine and can be consumed fresh or processed into jams and beverages. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks.
